column4: Is there a reason why ubuntu is so unstable and unpredictable?
can you be more specific and less troll-worthy?
these things do not just magically happen, no matter how used to window's behavior you are. do you have automatic updates turned on?
again, these things do not magically happen. does anyone else use the computer? what have you done recently?
ubuntu fiesty? sounds like you're using OSS and not ALSA
what sound card? it's possible the sound card is blocking, if it's ancient or cheap
but you told me nothing changed?
lesson for today, in the computer (logical) world, answering "no" means "no". not "no, except for this, this, and this."
also, unless you see an update you need, you don't have to update really.
was a kernel update included? did it ask you to restart?
okay, so we're getting closer now: what kind of sound card do you have? PCI or onboard?
does it show up in "lspci"? (open a terminal, type "lspci" look for "creative sound blaster" or otherwise)
no, they don't use sudo. init is setuid root, and init runs those things
